contents.title: How to use
contents.description: Learn how to use Nuxt zodI18n.

children.value: This is only a basic example of what you can achieve with Nuxt zodI18n.
As you see you don't need to add extra message in into the schema to have translated answers.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
  import type { Login } from '~/schema/login.schema'
  import type { FormSubmitEvent } from '#ui/types'

  import { loginSchema } from '~/schema/login.schema'

  const state = reactive({
    name: undefined,
    email: undefined
  })

  function onSubmit (event: FormSubmitEvent<Login>) {
    console.log(event.data)
  }
</script>

<template>
  <UForm 
    :schema="loginSchema" 
    :state="state" 
    class="flex flex-col gap-6 pt-6" 
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <UFormGroup label="Name" name="name">
      <UInput v-model="state.name" placeholder="Your name" />
    </UFormGroup>
    <UFormGroup label="Email" name="email">
      <UInput v-model="state.email" placeholder="Your email" />
    </UFormGroup>
    <UButton type="submit" class="w-fit">
      Save
    </UButton>
  </UForm>
</template>

contents.title: Overload translation
contents.description: Learn how to overload translation from zodI18n.

children.value: You can overload translation that comes from Nuxt zodI18n by adding them into your own translation files.
All zod translations are under the

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
  import type { Website } from '~/schema/website.schema'
  import type { FormSubmitEvent } from '#ui/types'

  import { websiteSchema } from '~/schema/website.schema'

  const state = reactive({
    name: 'My website',
    url: 'lol'
  })

  function onSubmit (event: FormSubmitEvent<Website>) {
    console.log(event.data)
  }
</script>

<template>
  <UForm :schema="websiteSchema" :state="state" class="flex flex-col gap-6 pt-6" @submit="onSubmit">
    <UDivider />
    <UFormGroup label="Name" name="name">
      <UInput v-model="state.name" placeholder="Website name" />
    </UFormGroup>
    <UFormGroup label="Url" name="url">
      <UInput v-model="state.url" placeholder="Website url" />
    </UFormGroup>
    <UButton type="submit" class="w-fit">
      Save
    </UButton>
  </UForm>
</template>

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
  import type { Website } from '~/schema/website.schema'
  import type { FormSubmitEvent } from '#ui/types'

  import { websiteSchema } from '~/schema/website.schema'

  const state = reactive({
    color: '',
  })

  function onSubmit (event: FormSubmitEvent<Website>) {
    console.log(event.data)
  }
</script>

<template>
  <UForm :schema="websiteSchema" :state="state" class="flex flex-col gap-6 pt-6" @submit="onSubmit">
    <UDivider />
    <UFormGroup label="Color" name="color">
      <UInput v-model="state.color" placeholder="Enter color" />
    </UFormGroup>
    <UButton type="submit" class="w-fit">
      Save
    </UButton>
  </UForm>
</template>

hero.title: Nuxt [zodI18n]{.text-primary}
hero.description: Easily Translate Zod's default error messages.:
hero.code:
# Quick Setup
```bash
npx nuxi@latest module add nuxt-zod-i18n
```
```ts [nuxt.config.ts]
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['nuxt-zod-i18n', '@nuxtjs/i18n']
})
```
